Pledge of good faith.

Yes. Mrs. Pearce!

Not that I mean any harm, mind you, …why not me too, eh? Why not?
Well, look at-- look at it my way.
What am I? I asked you, what am I?

It means he's up against middle-class morality for all of time.
If there's anything going and I puts in for a bit of it, it's always the same story.
You're undeserving, so you can't have it.
But my needs is as great as the most deserving widows that ever got money out of six different charities in one week I don't need less than a deserving man, I need more.
I don't eat less hearty than he does.
And I drink, oh, a lot more.
I'm playing straight with you.
I ain't pretending to be deserving. No, I'm undeserving.
And I mean to go on being undeserving. I like it and that's the truth.

Well, is five pounds unreasonable? I put it to you.
And I leave it to you.

Oh, not me, governor. So, help me, I won't.
Just one good spree for meself and the missus.
